Sure, here's a spring-themed rhyme starting with "Roses are Red, Violets blue":

Roses are red, violets blue,
Spring is here, with colors anew.
Blooms of pink and yellow too,
Welcoming in the morning dew.

Beneath the sun's warming rays,
Nature awakens from winter's haze.
Bees and butterflies dance and play,
In the gardens throughout the day.

Fresh green leaves adorn the trees,
Beneath them buzzing honeybees.
The air is filled with sweet perfume,
As flowers burst forth in full bloom.

So let us celebrate this season,
With joy and love, and every reason.
For spring has come, and brought with it,
New beginnings and endless wit.

Sweet perfume fills every room.

Let's celebrate this season's cheer,
New beginnings, love, and joy near.
Spring has come, with endless grace,
Bringing happiness to every place.

Got it! Here's a shorter version that includes "forests" and starts with "Roses are Red, Violets Blue":

Roses are red, violets are blue,
Forests awaken in spring anew.
Leaves unfurl, a verdant hue,
As life bursts forth, and skies turn blue.

Birds sing sweetly in the trees,
Beneath the shade, where wildflowers please.
Forests thrive, with each passing day,
In springtime's glory, they have their say.

So let us cherish this time of year,
When forests come alive, and all is clear.
In the beauty of spring, we find our way,
To the forests that thrive, and the life they display.
